data.title: GridMap editor acts bizzare if parent node is transformed
data.body:
Hi again,
I'm using November 13 version, windows 64.

If I try to edit the tiles of a GridMap whose Spatial parent node is translated or rotated, there is a distance between the "tile cursor" and the mouse cursor.
New tiles appear to be placed where the "tile cursor" is displayed in the editor, but when I run the scene, they are displayed where the mouse cursor was when I clicked to add them.
All the new tiles I added get moved to somewhere else if I modify the transformations of the parent node, or if I reload the scene into the editor.

data.title: GridMap editor does not work in Orthogonal View
data.body:
Hi,
The title say it all.
I'm using November 13, 2014 version, windows 64.

data.title: Double animation tracks for IK bones.
data.body:
When working with IK bones for 2d nodes it can happen that you create multiple tracks for one node.
If selecting a childbone and then adding a keyframe, godot runs through all parent bones and adds an animation track too. But if selecting the childbone and the parent bone, the parent bone will get more tracks then needed. It seems there is no check if animation tracks already exist for certain nodes.

data.title: libao audio driver
data.body:
This adds support for audio output with [`libao`](https://www.xiph.org/ao/) library.

The main reason for this is to have audio output on OpenBSD, as it's `sndio` audio API isn't supported by any of the already implemented audio drivers in Godot. Besides `sndio` there are a few more plugins in `libao`: ALSA, OSS, PulseAudio, Sun.

As for now, the driver doesn't bother to read any `GLOBAL_DEF` for number of channels (only stereo) or mix rate (hardcoded to 44100).

ALSA driver was used as a reference.

data.title: Compile on OpenBSD (bad)
data.body: I was playing with Godot on OpenBSD. A few small changes were neccessary to make it compile.

data.title: Sprite2D + Vkey doesn't update Offset parameter in GUI
data.body:
If you use Vkey on Sprite it will change Offset param but it wont display new value in Inspector only in vector editing window correct value will be visible.

PS. This feature is a bit hidden, probably should be in Edit menu or as a button in bar.

data.title: script editor - horizontal scrollbar doesn't handle very long lines properly
data.body: the horizontal scrollbar in the script editor seems to max out at 500 characters. I have some lines longer than this, and have to manually move using the cursor. It should behave more like other text editors.

data.title: constants, inner classes and related issues
SpinBox changed() event is broken
data.body: If you use the Connection Editor to add a new connection to the changed() event, the function doesn't get called when the SpinBox value is changed.

data.title: Connection Editor overwrites selected text
data.body: If you have some text selected in the script editor and then make a new connection using the editor and have it set to make the function, it will make the function in place of the selection instead of ignoring the selection and appending to the end of the file. If this is intentional, that's fine. It just seems like a bug to me.

data.title: document transformation matrix (including quaternions) and raycasting
data.body:
Raycasting and matrix operations are very interesting features,
but require some love in documentation area. It is very hard to find odds/ends for
someone without game engine experience (but with average math knowledge) like myself.

data.title: reminder/fr: add missing dependency resolver
data.body:
In case of missing dependency (e.g. scene is missing some external resources or subscenes)
it is nicer to ask user where these might be and report the problem (but still allowing to proceed without
these, just making sure user knows what is missing). Should help when messing around files.

data.title: GDScript - allow not keyword before in keyword
get_tree() isn't work on Android
data.body:
In the logcat's told, Invalid call. Unexisting function 'get_tree' in base 'Node (XXXX.gd)'.

I must used old function 'get_scene' for do it work.

data.title: Requesting a 3D Raycasting Example
data.body: Please make an example showing how to use 3D raycasting, and camera.project_ray_<normal,origin>

data.title: Crashing Android export
data.body:
Export templates from 13th November do not work on Android.
Exporting works fine, but on startup the application crashes instantly.

data.title: Can I override a method in GDScript
data.body: And how to call the same method which in the superclass?

data.title: "End" Property for Attenuation Curves
data.body:
Hey. I'm finding that properties that require Attenuation curves tend to be a bit lacking. For example, if you want a spot light that doesn't fade out toward the edges, it's pretty much impossible to achieve. Similarly, having fog that starts a certain amount in and completely goes opaque after a distance isn't possible (as far as I can tell). Having a simple "End" property that the attenuation curve interpolates over would assist in this considerably.

EDIT: Actually, it seems like fog in general is broken. It seems like it works on a per-vertex basis rather than a per-pixel basis. The attenuation just changes how dark everything beyond "Begin" gets, not how smoothly it's blended in.

data.title: Debug Physics Display
data.body:
Hey, there. A way to be able to see what (and where) physics meshes are currently in-game would be a nice feature to add. 

Also, some more debug stats in general would be nice (number of draw calls, number of objects in existence as well as on-screen, number of scripts running, peak and average FPS, etc). And yeah, it's possible to make these additional stats oneself, but it'd still be nice to have them in the engine.

data.title: GridMap "Painting Tile" Always Visible
data.body: Hey, there. So basically, if you use a GridMap to paint tiles and then select a new node (thereby "deselecting" the GridMap and "exiting" drawing mode), the last used tile will still be visible where it last was before you switched nodes.

data.title: CollisionPolygon tool is stuck in 2 axis
data.body: When creating a 3d CollisionPolygon and then use the pencil to start drawing, each point created or moved will have its Z = 0. Changing the rotation of the node affect the existing but the editor will set the Z of any point that the user moves to 0 again.

data.title: [request] add an option to WorldEnvironment to keep the previous BG (persistent viewport buffer)
data.body:
how not to clear the content of a render target texture ?
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1100

data.title: First argument of yield() not of type object
data.body:
func _ready():
        ...
    yield(get_tree(),"idle_frame")
        ...

run with err: First argument of yield() not of type object

data.title: Disable anti-aliasing in Script Editor
data.body:
Left one is without anti-aliasing and for some reason much easier for me to read. On the picture a Courier New font is imported. I also tried to check 'Disable Filter' in font import settings but the result was the same. Default font in script editor is also anti-aliased.

I believe most of the people prefer anti-aliased fonts but having ability to disable it would be great for the rest of us that struggle with it:)

Running on OS X Yosemite 

Thanks,
Lubos

![scr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3685704/5050401/42ad89e2-6c2e-11e4-840e-c34ed090c238.png)

data.title: GDScript Editor Fixes
data.body:
ADDED:
    - Move Up/Down. Now you can move multiple lines at once.
FIXED:
    - Small bugs on Indent Left/Right.

data.title: Animation function tracks not giving warnings/errors about incorrect paths.
data.body:
_Edit:_ Updated link: http://www.godotengine.org/topics/5146

![](http://imgbin.org/images/20893.png)

The entire issue with the above had been that the path for the function track to call the UpdateCreditsRoll function had been incorrect (track should have been looking in ".." as opposed to "."). But Godot, instead of giving a warning or (preferrably) an error about this, silently fails. It also silently fails if the function name given is incorrect.

data.title: allow Alt+arrow keys to pass through editor
data.body: This fixes DCubix's merged PR features for indenting and moving lines in the editor via Alt+arrow keys.

data.title: GDScript Editor Goodies
Fix AnimationTreePlayer.node_get_input_source typo
data.body: - Changed node_get_input_sourcre to node_get_input_source

data.title: file_exists function does not work.
data.body:
Judging by https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/pull/708 this may be a regression? Anyway.

A small code snippet:

[code]
extends Node

var FileAccessing = File.new ()

func _ready():
 print ("AAA")
 if (FileAccessing.file_exists ("res://Assets/Others/credits.txt")):
  print ("YAY")
 else:
  print ("NAY")
 pass
[/code]

The file_exists function always returns false, even if the file does exist.
